comment: Dr. T. is an inspirational instructor.  He is organized, student friendly, knowledgeable and always impeccably dressed.  Highly Recommended.

This class had weekly summaries do of case studies or articles. He wasn't tough on the grading he just is looking to make sure you actually read it. Group project where you present 2 times. Very understanding and kind professor. You have to be trying hard to not pass this class.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Group projects--So many papers

comment: Excellent teacher.  Inspirational.  I would highly recommend him.

Grade is based on attendance/participation, weekly article summaries, weekly chapter quizzes, and the final marketing plan projects including a paper and presentation. It's a hard class content wise, but he grades fairly and he's a great professor.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Lecture heavy

comment: Professor T was a great professor! He cares about the success and professional development of his students. Your grade is determined by group projects, class participation, summary write-ups, and an individual final project. I would 10/10 recommend for Strategic Marketing - one of the best professors I've had in my MBA program!

Dr. T. is great.  He fosters a democratic environment and encourages class participation.  Do not miss any of his classes.  He is strict with deadlines but fair with grading.  His sense of humor is unique and creative. I would take him again and again.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: Best professor in the MBA program. The course is pretty group project heavy, but the presentations/papers are designed in a way where you truly learn. A lot of reading and writing but you will learn so much. Very funny and personable professor. Doesn't grade too harshly, very fair. Wish I could take this course again just for Dr. T!

Dr T was the man! Chit chat with him and get on a good level with him and your golden, GO TO CLASS, if he sees you in class, you passed!  His jokes are hilarious for an older gentleman. Likes for the gallery to interact.  Ends every class with "we will meet here next week if that okay with everyone else" cancelled class when one person said nah lol

Insane amount of work! Strict with grading/deadlines (won't respond to emails about make-ups). Discussions, quizzes weekly and tedious assignments due near end of semester. Regret taking him due to stress this class gave me. I finished my four other summer courses in four weeks (8wk session) and his took me the whole time and I struggled. AVOID

Dr.T was one of the best professors I have ever taken. He is so funny and tries really hard to make the course not so intimidating. STUDY for tests and you should do well. I used the practice quizzes to study and did really well w that. Modules are super easy. GET THE BOOK. Overall- love Dr.T and would def take again!
Dr. Tashchian, is an amazing professor.  This was the best course that I have taken at KSU.  Very personable and easy to relate.  Highly recommended.
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Clear grading criteria--So many papers

comment: Dr. T. is a great professor.  Knowledgeable and expert in marketing research.  He is very student oriented and cares about you.  Make sure to attend all his classes.

If you are able to easily learn programs -- SPSS, then you will not struggle in this class. He is a great professor, especially for a 9am class. His humor is unforgettable. His testing style is old-school which thew me off. I did rly bad on all exams and great on everything else. Respect him and he respects you! Get a good group for the project!

if you go to class and do the work you can easily get a B if thats your goal, spss assignments that get explained in class was helpful, a group project w/ decent amt of work so just get a good group! hes a nice guy and really wants you to understand the material so ask away and hes a pretty funny guy in person!
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Group projects

comment: he is a calm relaxed teacher, who gives you everything you need to learn.

Professor T was a good professor. Funny, and very knowledgeable about marketing research. 60-70 question tests, but the practice tests help. Come to class, don't be on your phone and pay attention, and you will pass.
3 chapters a week with quizzes and discussion posts for each plus a 15 page assignment at the end of the semester. Way too much work for a summer semester.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Test heavy

comment: Each week you have two chapter questions due as well as a chapter quiz that uses webcam lockdown browser and yes he actually watches the videos. He is one of those professors that assumes his class is your only class for the semester. Also uses the points system for grades so it's difficult to calculate your grade throughout the semester.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--TEST HEAVY

comment: An expert in Marketing Research with a lot of industry experience. Fair and approachable. Will help you if you make an effort to contact him. I would highly recommend this professor if you want to learn marketing research.
Great professor. Well organized class and lectures. Don't miss his class and do not use your cell phone. Relevant and useful material. Very knowledgeable.
Great teacher. Cares about students learning the material. Don't miss any of his classes and do not us a cell phone. Overall, highly recommended.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures--Caring

comment: In an online environment, there is little to no interaction or personality. He doesn't accept late work. The system went down during the 48 hours that the quizzes are open and he was reluctant to extend the deadline. Do no miss any assignments, follow the book. You can get expect to get a B/C. Miss or mess up and you will be barely passing.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Participation matters--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: i wish that i did not have to take this boring course...

I really enjoyed this guy. He is hilarious, but the material is boring to most. Read the book and do ALL the assignment and you will do well. You will have to create, disseminate and analyze responses for a questionnaire. Semester long group project, 2 breezy presentations. Don't use cell in class! He'll hold it against you! Always go to class.

I can't really complain about this class, but the amount of work was tedious. 2 online discussion type questions & 1 chapter quiz due every week. 2 heavily weighted assignments & 1 heavily weighted final case analysis. If you do everything you are asked to do, you will receive an A. If you skip afew quizzes/discussions, you will get a B or C.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--Clear grading criteria

comment: VERY strict attendance policy, you miss over 4 classes you will fail or get a C in the class. Group project work and homework are present throughout the course and keeps you busy. I did not feel overwhelmed at any point by the work. But watch out for his slow and boring lectures with some comedy mixed in here and there. Study his quizzes for exams!
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Hilarious--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: very tough class over the summer.  so many proojects and hard tests.  Incredible amount of reading.  Very tricky test questions.  definitely not a summer class
Great professor.  Very responsive.  Would answer my emails almost immediately.  Highly recommended.
A hilarious, inspirational, and all around amazing man. I wish he was my dad.
He is an amazing teacher and an amazing person.

Fairly easy class. Grades easy on presentations and reports but is a lot of work. Very difficult exams that you will actually have to study for. I did bad on all and still got a B in the class. If I actually studied I would've gotten an A. Make sure you pick a good group; you're stuck with them the whole semester!

I just completed Dr. Tashchian's Marketing Research class.  The course is demanding but I think I would get an A in the class.  This has been the most useful courses that I have taken at KSU.  The professor is intelligent, organized and student-friendly.  He goes out of his way to help and accommodate students.  Highly recommended.

this is the worst professor I have ever had. The test are very hard and he is very unhelpful.  I tried to email him and he would never reply and he never liked  when students meet with him in his office hours. Would call out students in the middle of the class and made you feel dumb if you had questions. I am an A students pass√©d his class with C
If you follow the assignments you will be fine.  Responds quickly and is responsive to individual situations.  Expect to do a lot of work but it isn't hard if you put in the time.
Dr. T. is one of the best profs that I've had at KSU.  Knowledgeable, professional and friendly.  Don't miss any of his classes and don't use your cell phone during his lectures.
Great Teacher.  Willing to help.  Professional and very knowledgeable.  Highly Recommended.
Great Professor.  Highly Recommended.  Very knowledgeable.  Don't miss any of his classes.
Very Good Professor.  Very Knowledgeable about Consumer Behavior.  Professional, friendly and always well dressed.  Highly Recommended.
Great Profssor.  He is very fair and helpful but not an easy professor.  Make sure you don't miss any of his classes.  I would recommend his class if you would like to learn Marketing Research.

Professor Tashchian is a wonderful professor. I took him over the summer and I received a well-earned A. You really need to study diligently for his tests, but if you do, an A or B is definitely achievable. There were 3 tests and one big group project and a small homework assignment. He is a great teacher, and I learned a lot from him.

Not to be extreme, but this was the worst professor I have ever taken. Wait until Prof. Albert becomes available for this class. His lectures don't modify the tests, if you get into a non-performing group your grade will suffer (work ethic isn't rewarded--socialist beliefs) , very unorganized, treats students like kids due to cellphone usage

I think he is the worst professor I have ever had at KSU. Lectures jump around - skips slides...'you can review later'. Appears unprepared for class, tries to be funny - to hide his lack of teaching skill.  All lectures (2/3 of classes) on single exam. Case studies & presentations last few classes.  Grades slow to get back, waits to last minute.

Dr. Tashchian is the best professor in the marketing department in terms of teaching ability, but he is certainly not the easiest.  The workload is fair, but the tests are very hard.  He still gives you the benefit of the doubt in grading any essays or papers.  He's definitely the preferred professor for MKTG 8030.

Good teacher, willing to help if you ask. Tests are hard; multiple choice with tricky/confusing questions. Many questions come from the textbook. Takes attendance. Do not take during summer, too much group work for condensed time.

Very funny, though subtle.  Extremely knowledgeable and helpful if you ask.  A good group is very important as you do have quite a bit of work, 2 group cases, a marketing plan, weekly quizes,and an individual case for a final.  Recommend.
Dry sense of humor. He is a good professor. I would recommend.

Be sure to bring a cup of java with you to class! Prof. speaks in monotone and can put you to sleep. Very knowledgeable. Did not use textbook in class but U R responsible for knowing text material for tests. Group work was easy but tedious work early. Prof. is approachable, funny at times, and smart. Attendance is recorded.

TONS of work. Group case studies, individual case studies, group marketing plans...on top of weekly quizzes and a final exam. Nice guy, subtle sense of humor. Consistently late to class. Not bad, but don't slack off.

Not that great of a teacher. Ridiculously hard tests.  Test questions Multiple choice but obnoxiosly tricky to the point where you may know the answer but miss the question because he provides inaccurate information that is often contrary of the text book's interpretation.  Test questions are also confusing because of the wording used.

Dr Taschian is very funny, but he is also unorganized.  There doesnt seem to be a basis for his grading.  The workload will sneak up on you.  Having a competent group is very important.  Lax members will cost you a better grade.  I dont feel like I took much from his class.
great teacher!! very helpful and funny. definately would take again. started iffy but he changed his way of teaching during the semester- A LOT MORE CLEAR NOW!
